properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 8 at 11:08AM AKST until February 8 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* LOCATION...Bristol Bay coast.

* WAVES AND SURF...Expect high surf around and near high tide
today (Saturday). Waves over open waters of Bristol Bay will
reach 10 to 17 ft this afternoon. With south winds of 50 kts
over the bay, these waves will build and move toward the
northern coast of Bristol Bay.

* SEA ICE...Strong winds and waves will cause ice shoves,
primarily along the northern coastline of Bristol Bay.

* TIMING...9 am to 6 pm today, with the highest water levels
around time of high tide. High tide will occur during the early
afternoon hours for most of the Bristol Bay coast.

* IMPACTS...High surf and wave action and coastal erosion are
possible. Expect ice shoves.
properties.instruction:
A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion. Coastal
residents should be alert for rising water levels and take action
to protect property along the immediate coastline.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING ALONG THE BRISTOL BAY COAST
